subject: RE: [junit] JUnit or Unit Testing Wiki
msgSnippet: yup you hit the mark and get the cigar. This is what I was looking for : UnitTestingRuby UnitTesstingJava UnitTestingJavaAbstractClasses
messageBody:
yup

you hit the mark and get the cigar.

This is what I was looking for :

UnitTestingRuby
UnitTesstingJava
UnitTestingJavaAbstractClasses
UnitTestingJavaPrivateMembers
UnitTestingPython

etc...

Most of this info is contained within the XP and junit mailing lists or
obfuscated within Ward's wiki. Don't get me wrong here, I think Ward's wiki is
an excellent resource and when combined with the current junit docs and, for
those of us that like theory, Binder's book it it excellent way of learning
Unit Testing. Yet I think there are a lot of newbies and experts that would
appreciate a wiki were we can find what we need without the need of reading 20+
emails. Also, since we refactor mercilesly is there a place that complements
the refactoring with UnitTestingMoveMethod.

This is what I would like to see. [Is the above a System Metaphor?]

So before Kent says it I will say it to myself "Well then write it."

Anybody has any comments, suggestions, a box with a fresh wiki install?

-H

--- Michael Finney <mfinney@...> wrote:
> Well... being "done with it" may mean the person was tired of reading what
> was there.
>
> I think the hope is that a wiki site devoted to unit testing would more of
> what the person is looking for.
>
> Michael Finney
> Sun Certified Programmer for the Java 2 Platform
> Sun Certified Developer for the Java 2 Platform
>
